Package researchsim.entities

Class Fauna

  • Object
    • Entity
      • Fauna
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collectable, Encodable, Movable
    public class Fauna
extends Entity
implements Movable, Collectable
    Fauna is all the animal life present in a particular region or time. Fauna can move around the scenario and be collected by the User.

    NOTE: Some methods in this class require interaction with the ScenarioManager. Only interact with it when you need it.

    A suite of tests for this class were implemented in assignment 1
    Partially implemented in assignment 1, to be completed in assignment 2

        Creates a fauna (Animal) with a given size, coordinate and habitat.
        Parameters:
        size - size associated with the animal
        coordinate - coordinate associated with the animal
        habitat - habitat tiles associated with the animal
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if habitat is not TileType.LAND or TileType.OCEAN
        Implemented in assignment 1

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the human-readable name of this animal. The name is determined by the following table.

        Human-readable names
          Habitat
        LAND OCEAN
        Size SMALL Mouse Crab
        MEDIUM Dog Fish
        LARGE Horse Shark
        GIANT Elephant Whale

        e.g. if this animal is MEDIUM in size and has a habitat of LAND then its name would be "Dog"

        Specified by:
        getName in class Entity
        Returns:
        human-readable name
        Implemented in assignment 1

      • encode

        public String encode()
        Returns the machine-readable string representation of this animal.

        The format of the string to return is 

        Fauna-size-coordinate-habitat
        Where:
        • size is the animal's associated size
        • coordinate is the encoding of the animal's associated coordinate
        • habitat is the animal's associated habitat
        For example: 
        Fauna-SMALL-4,6-LAND
        Specified by:
        encode in interface Encodable
        Overrides:
        encode in class Entity
        Returns:
        encoded string representation of this animal
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code of this animal.

        Two animals that are equal according to the equals(Object) method should have the same hash code.

        Overrides:

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Object other)
        Returns true if and only if this animal is equal to the other given object.

        For two animals to be equal, they must have the same size, coordinate and habitat.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Entity
        Parameters:
        other - the reference object with which to compare
        Returns:
        true if this animal is the same as the other argument; false otherwise
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the human-readable string representation of this animal.

        The format of the string to return is: 

        name [Fauna] at coordinate [habitat]
        Where:
        • name is the animal's human-readable name according to getName()
        • coordinate is the animal's associated coordinate in human-readable form
        • habitat is the animal's associated habitat
        For example: 
        Dog [Fauna] at (2,5) [LAND]
        Overrides:
        toString in class Entity
        Returns:
        human-readable string representation of this animal
        See Also:
        getName()
        Implemented in assignment 1

      • getPossibleMoves

        public List<Coordinate> getPossibleMoves()
        Returns a List of all the possible coordinates that this animal can move to.

        The possible coordinates that this animal can move to are defined as:
        Any Coordinate in Movable.checkRange(int, Coordinate) (checkRange(move distance, current coordinate)) that this animal can move to (See canMove(Coordinate)).
        Any CoordinateOutOfBoundsException's thrown by canMove(Coordinate) are squashed.

        The order of the returned coordinates does not matter.

        Specified by:
        getPossibleMoves in interface Movable
        Returns:
        list of possible movements
        See Also:
        Movable.checkRange(int, Coordinate), canMove(Coordinate), Size.moveDistance
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • move

        public void move​(Coordinate coordinate)
        Moves the animal to the new coordinate.

        The Tile that the animal moves to should now be occupied by this animal.

        The tile that the animal moves from (the existing coordinate) should now have no occupant.

        A MoveEvent should be created and added to the current scenario logger.

        Specified by:
        move in interface Movable
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The new coordinate to move to
        See Also:
        Tile.setContents(Entity), User.move(Coordinate)
        Requires:
        canMove(Coordinate) == true
        Ensures:
        the state of the tile that the animal is inhabiting, the tile that the animal is going to are both updated, the event is logged
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(Coordinate coordinate)
                throws CoordinateOutOfBoundsException
        Determines if the animal can move to the new coordinate.

        An animal can move to the new coordinate if ALL of the following conditions are satisfied:

        • The new coordinate must be different from the current coordinate.
        • The coordinate given is on the current scenario map (See ScenarioManager).
        • The distance from the given coordinate to the current coordinate is not greater than the distance this animal can move (Size.moveDistance)
        • If the animal's habitat is OCEAN then the tile at the coordinate must be OCEAN
        • If the animal's habitat is LAND then the tile at the coordinate must NOT be OCEAN
        • The tile at the coordinate is not already occupied
        • The animal has an unimpeded path (meaning all the above conditions are true) for each tile it must traverse to reach the destination coordinate

        The animal can only turn once.
        i.e. can not move diagonally but rather n tiles in the horizontal plane followed by m tiles in the vertical plane (or vice versa). Similar to how a knight moves in chess.

        For example:
        If the animal wants to move from (0,0) to (2,1) on the following encoded map. 

         LLL
 LSL
 LLL
        (The above map is not possible to be created normally as the minimum dimensions are 5 x 5)
        It would have to be able to move to all the following coordinates: 
        [(1,0),(2,0),(2,1)]
        OR 
        [(0,1),(1,1),(2,1)]
        Specified by:
        canMove in interface Movable
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The new coordinate
        Returns:
        true if the above conditions are satisfied else false
        Throws:
        CoordinateOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinate given is out of bounds
        See Also:
        TileType.encode(), User.canMove(Coordinate)
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • collect

        public int collect​(User user)
        A User interacts and collects this animal.
        Upon collection the following should occur:
        • A CollectEvent should be created with the animal and coordinate.
        • The Tile that the animal was occupying should now be unoccupied (empty).
        • The animal should be removed from the current scenario's animal controller.

        The given user will gain a number of points for collecting this animal. This value is determined by the animals size.

        Specified by:
        collect in interface Collectable
        Parameters:
        user - the user that collects the entity.
        Returns:
        points earned
        See Also:
        Size.points
        Implement this for assignment 2
